dt: {bc}to make the object of a joke {bc}{sx|kid||}

shortdef: to make the object of a joke : kid

dt: used to introduce a serious statement that follows a humorous statement

dt.t: It looks like this is a job for Superman! But {it}joking apart{/it}, this is a serious problem and we're going to need help.

shortdef: —used to introduce a serious statement that follows a humorous statement

dt: used to introduce a serious statement that follows a humorous statement

dt.t: It looks like this is a job for Superman! But {it}joking aside{/it}, this is a serious problem and we're going to need help.

shortdef: —used to introduce a serious statement that follows a humorous statement

dt: used say that what someone is saying is very surprising or hard to believe

dt.t: "He said the report is due by tomorrow." "{it}He must be joking{/it}."

shortdef: —used say that what someone is saying is very surprising or hard to believe

dt: used to say that what someone is saying is very surprising or hard to believe

dt.t: "The report is due by tomorrow." "{it}You're joking{/it}."

shortdef: —used to say that what someone is saying is very surprising or hard to believe
